q1: do you think the video assistant referee is a good idea?
a1: yes, referees on the field are human too, they make mistakes. it helps to have another look at a situation if need be.
a1_skt: yes, referees on the @object are human too, they make mistakes. it helps to have another look at a situation if need be.
a1_v2: yes, referees on the field are human too, they make mistakes. it helps to have another look at a situation if need be.

q3: will using video assistant referees slow the game down?
a3: no, i don't think it will slow the game down.
a3_skt: no, i don't think it will slow the game down.
a3_v2: no, i don't think it will slow the game down.

q4: isnt it better to have the human error factor in the game?
a4: there is too much technology.  they will always use playbacks now.
a4_skt: there is too much technology.  they will always use playbacks now.
a4_v2: there is too much technology.  they will always use playbacks now.

q5: do you think that var will still be used in the future ?
a5: yes, video assistance referee allows you to get a better look at the field and players.
a5_skt: yes, video assistance referee allows you to get a better look at the @object and players.
a5_v2: yes, video assistance referee allows you to get a better look at the field and players.
